means: （宗教捐税）什一税，什一的教区税，小部分

sentence.Network_en: I haven't heard a tithe of it.
Taxpayers can not get even a tithe of their money back.
sentence.Network_cn: 纳税人连自己所付税款的十分之一都拿不回来.

sentence.Network_en: I cannot remember a tithe of it.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 什一税(tithe)，欧洲基督教会向居民征收的一种宗教捐税，源起于《旧约》时代。 相关文献备受争议的税比特税 | 富人税 | 罪恶税 | N…

list.abs: but investigators say he gave more than 80 % of the proceeds to a church in Lagos as tithes and offerings .但是调查人员称，他将超过80%的资金捐赠给拉格斯一家教堂，作为教区税和献礼。

for ye tithe mint and rue and all mannerand pass over judgment and the love of God : these ought ye to have done and not to leave the other undone .因为你们将薄荷、芸香并各样菜蔬献上十分之一，那公义和爱神的事反倒不行了。这原是你们当行的；那也是不可不行的。

for ye tithe mint and rue and all mannerand pass over judgment and the love of God : these ought ye to have done and not to leave the other undone .因为你们将薄荷、芸香并各样菜蔬献上十分之一，那公义和爱神的事反倒不行了。这原是你们当行的；那也是不可不行的。
My church requires that I tithe week order to be a member of their congregation ., 为了成为他们教会中的一员 , 我的教堂要求我每周捐款.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tēotha (adjective in the ordinal sense 'tenth', used in a specialized sense as a noun), tēothian (verb)

entry.tran: (定期定量缴纳给教会、慈善机构等的)什一税，捐税，捐款
entry.def: A tithe is a fixed amount of money or goods that is given regularly in order to support a church, a priest, or a charity.

means.word_mean: 1. a levy of one tenth of something
2. an offering of a tenth part of some personal income
2. levy a tithe on (produce or a crop);
3. pay one tenth of; pay tithes on, especially to the church;

sentences.sentence: "He tithed his income to the Church"

means.word_mean: 4. pay a tenth of one's income, especially to the church;

sentences.sentence: "Although she left the church officially, she still tithes"
